text.text:
I recently stayed at this hotel, and while the room was spacious and well-equipped with all necessary facilities, my experience was far from comfortable. Unfortunately, I struggled to sleep for an entire week due to a mosquito issue. Although I rarely opened the windows, it’s possible that housekeeping did, allowing mosquitoes to enter. It would have been appreciated if the staff had ensured the room was pest-free before leaving.

The complimentary breakfast was quite average, with limited options that didn't meet expectations.

Overall, my stay was disappointing and uncomfortable. I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

text.text:
I stayed at Oakwood Residence in Pune and while the location is very good, the rooms definitely need an update. The biggest disappointment was at breakfast. There was no system to record guest names, which caused confusion and unnecessary waiting. When I pointed this out, instead of fixing the issue, the manager got defensive and actually told me “don’t say anything about management it’s good .” “Who does that” ?

This response was completely unacceptable. As a guest, I have every right to share feedback, especially when it concerns fairness and basic service. What if someone else had simply walked ahead of us because there was no record? The lack of accountability and the dismissive attitude from the manager left a very poor impression. A property like this has potential, but experiences like these make it very disappointing.

The ambience, decor, colours, patterns were all very classy and exquisite. We enjoyed long hours of lazy lounging but the staff was very polite and patient with us. text.text: Stayed over the weekend for a self-reset. It was a very good experience. The check-in process was seamless and everything went smoothly. The breakfast buffet was yummmm and the staff was very attentive. I chose a corner seat and i was hidden away pretty much, but they found me and kept checking in and got me whatever I needed promptly. I really enjoyed that. Dinner buffet was also nice. The veg options were more than the non veg options but it was all good. There could be some more salad varieties but I loved it regardless. The room service was timely as well. I got a basil pesto spaghetti which was so rich that I couldn't finish it in one go. And the brownies were just heavenly. 10/10 recommended.

text.text:
My recent stay at Lemon Tree Hotel Viman Nagar was a pleasant experience! What truly stood out was the hotel's fantastic location. Being situated in Viman Nagar, it's incredibly convenient, especially if you are in Pune for business or catching a flight. I loved how easily accessible it was to the airport, which made my travel stress-free.

Beyond the location, the hotel had a welcoming vibe. The staff were friendly and attentive, always ready to help with a smile. The rooms were comfortable and well-maintained, providing a relaxing space to unwind after a busy day. It felt like a home away from home. If you are looking for a hotel with great connectivity, Lemon Tree Viman Nagar can be a great choice.

We visited Pune on the day 26th August for one day and stayed in The Central Park Hotel- Bund Garden Road- Pune.
We received truly exceptional service from the front desk team. They were so helpful.
This was a relaxing and enjoyable experience, and we will definitely recommend your hotel " The Central Park Hotel - Bund Garden Road-Pune" to friends and family.
The room was beyond comfortable, and we really appreciated the attention to detail.
The amenities, like the complimentary breakfast, added so much value to our stay.  We loved the comfortable beds and the high-quality linens; it made for a perfect  night's sleep.
Your staff's professionalism and kindness made our stay so pleasant, specially Mr. Nainesh (Guest Relation Manager)  & Mr. Santa Cruz. (Trip Advisor).
Thank you very much for complimentary dinner as a gift to us from you.

text.text:
The hotel is being run by an amazing team of people right from the guys at the gate (security guys), at reception, restaurant and the housekeeping staff (who rarely get mentioned in any hotel reviews). The team is well coordinated.

The team goes extra mile to ensure your stay is comfortable and displays warm hospitality. Kudos to the whole team.

In short if I have to use a single word to describe the team... It ll be probably INCREDIBLE

They ll go extra mile to make to feel at Home.

Rooms

The rooms are spacious and available with all basic amenities expected in a room. There is a mini fridge available. No issues absolutely. Their is newspaper/magazines/snacks/tea pot with essentials etc etc available and replaced on a regular basis and as and when required. In fact they ll always put some extra/additional items for your comfort and utility.

Food

The restaurant serves amazing 🤩 food and a great spread. The chef's at live counters are extremely friendly and they ll make any dish you require. The team at restaurant is welcoming and displays warmth hospitality

Would highly recommend a stay.  🎯

Some observations for management -

a) Rooms on 6th floor lack proper sound proofing and you can hear TV sounds played by adjacent room. This needs to be addressed. It just requires installing sound proofing materials in between rooms. However no such issues in other floors.

b) Gym, Spa and swimming are available on 6th floor. In my opinion, the Gym needs an upgrade. It is located in a smaller sized area. They should upgrade their gym with additional treadmills and additional multi gym.

text.text:
I stayed for two nights. There is nothing great to mention about the hospitality and the services. The rooms are decent for the charges and the facilities provided.It is a good hotel to stay for business overnight stay if the area of interest is within the Pune Camp area. What upset me was that I was allotted a renovated room and there was renovation still going on in the floor which was a messy affair.The renovated rooms had a funny interior setup which I wonder if it would be appreciated by the majority guests.
Nothing great about all the other services highlighted by the Hotel.
The hypocrisy of the Hotel also came to display when they were planning Independence celebration in the morning hours and few of my war veterans/armed forces friends came to meet me but they could not offer the basic hospitality to them and I had to take them to the Coffee shop at nearby INOX  to have a cup of Coffee. The only facility available @ 9am to host my guests on Independence Day was the buffet breakfast  and no provision to offer any Coffee to guests.I brought this to the notice of the Senior Lady in the counter but she had an indifferent attitude.
God Bless such Hypocrisy.

text.text:
I traveled to India in the month of July, and staying at this hotel was truly one of the best decisions I made. I was extremely stressed about the work I had to get done and I had been travelling for 9 hours, but the moment i finally got to the hotel it was such a breath of fresh air. For starters, the staff is so SO friendly, helpful and accommodating. I believe it was Atul and another gentleman whose name I unfortunately can't remember who greeted us at reception, and the check in process was quick.

Please keep in mind they have the European plug points, for which I hadnt come prepared. The staff was so incredibly kind that one of staff members went out of their way to accompany us to a shop that had this plug point at 7ish in the night. They didn't have to do that, and yet they did.

On check out day I was struggling to find a cab at 5.30 am. All the staff that was gathered there assured me and reassured me that they will make sure we find a cab. They even went to the extent of saying if we don't have a cab, one of the staff from the security team who has a tuk will take us to the airport 🥹 I can't tell you what a kind staff this hotel has and how helpful they were.

They even sort out breakfast packs for you if you're unable to stay for breakfast which was the case for me on a few days. If flew twice to India and I chose Cocoon hotel without any doubt on my second trip as well because their customer service and hotel over all is FANTASTIC.

The rooms are almost like a suite, because you additionally have a kitchen and an attached sitting area with a balcony as well. The beds are incredibly comfortable!

Few things they could improve on would be to have a wider variety of food for the buffet. Their food was more vegetarian based, and the number of dishes at the buffet was limited.

Their alacarte menu though is really good. I highly recommend their cold coffee and chicken biryani.

One day upon request they even sent  tomato soup from the dinner buffet up to my room, even though I had just eaten from the buffet lol.

Also the entire hotel is sparkling clean, which was truly refreshing to see.

They could have a better selection of shampoos and conditioners as toiletries, because on the bottle it said 'shampoo and conditioner'.

Over all, I will confidently recommend this hotel to anyone any day. They made my stay in Pune one of the most restful trips given that I was in India for some stressful work. Their staff, the gentleman who carried our bags to the rooms, the security team, Atul, Arjun (if I got his name correctly) and the rest of the team at reception were nothing short of fantastic. I don't understand how there are negative reviews on this hotel, because their kindness, prifessionalism, service was amazing. I'm a very picky person that isn't generous with good reviews, unless it was really good; and this place was par excellence. Cocoon hotel Pune, your staff deserves a raise.

text.text:
Absolutely Wonderful Stay – Felt Like Home!

We recently had the pleasure of staying at Royal Orchid Central Pune and I must say, it was an incredible experience from start to finish!

Right from the moment we checked in, the hospitality was top-notch. A big shoutout to Subhojeet and Pranali from the front office who went above and beyond to assist us. Despite a bit of a mix-up with the reservations team, they handled everything smoothly — arranging a smoking room for us and even extending our checkout time without any extra cost. It was such a relief and really made our stay more comfortable.

A special mention to the Front Office Manager (FOM) who ensured we got the best possible tariff, allowing us to enjoy a luxurious suite room which they usually don’t sale on OTAs. Their flexibility and understanding truly stood out.

The housekeeping team, especially Chetan and Tushar, were amazing as well. The room decoration was done beautifully and right on time, and they maintained cleanliness throughout our stay with a friendly and professional attitude.

Lastly, a big thank you to Tejas from the F&B team, who ensured our in-room dining experience was seamless and prompt. Every order was served with care and attention to detail.

Overall,bit ups and down but this stay was one of the best we’ve had in Pune after a long time where they have bathtubs in all the guest rooms, and it’s all thanks to the wonderful team at Royal Orchid Central. We felt genuinely cared for, and we can’t wait to return!

Highly recommended!

text.text:
I recently stayed at Royal Orchid Central, Pune, and overall, it was a wonderful experience. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, and the service across the board was prompt and courteous. Housekeeping was efficient, and the amenities offered were up to the mark for a comfortable business or leisure stay.

However, I did face one hiccup at the front desk, which left me a bit disappointed. I had inquired about any ongoing offers or discounts at their in-house restaurant for hotel guests—something that’s fairly common at most hotels. Initially, I was told there was an offer, but when it came time for billing, they denied any such discount without clear explanation. It felt like the front desk staff either weren’t informed or weren’t aligned with the restaurant’s communication, which was frustrating.

That aside, everything else was smooth. I would recommend the property for its location, cleanliness, and service—but do double-check restaurant details in writing if you’re relying on in-house dining offers.

text.text:
Disappointed by the Misleading Standards and Unprofessional Conduct

I had a very disappointing experience at Recedency Club, Pune — a property that falsely projects itself as a premium establishment charging five-star rates, but fails miserably when it comes to basic hygiene and customer service.

During my earlier stay, I encountered bed bugs in the room, which was both shocking and unacceptable for a place that charges such high prices. I shared my honest review online, only to be personally requested by Ms. Carol at the reception to remove it, with the assurance that pest control measures would be taken immediately and such issues would not happen again. Believing in their word and commitment to improvement, I took down the review in good faith.

However, on my recent trip to Pune, I reached out to Ms. Carol again to rebook the same room, hoping to see improvements firsthand. To my surprise, I was met with a completely unprofessional and dismissive attitude. They showed no courtesy, no intention to address my concerns, and no willingness to even speak professionally. Clearly, once the review was gone, so was their accountability.

This kind of behavior is not only unethical but also speaks volumes about how little they value guest safety, trust, and basic human dignity. Adding to my concern, this property is associated with the same family involved in last year’s tragic Porsche accident that resulted in the loss of innocent lives — a fact that adds an unsettling context to how little regard they seem to have for people’s wellbeing, both within and outside their premises.

I am writing this review again not out of frustration, but to warn future guests to think twice before trusting the “premium” claims made by Recedency Club Pune. Cleanliness, professionalism, and guest care should never be compromised — especially not when you’re charging five-star rates.

Recently booked the hotel for one day and had a decent experience but not at par with its price. Few things that disappointed me was-
1. The room was not properly maintained, there was left over hairs in bathroom.
2. They provided some very cheap coffee sachets and milk powder sachets.

I booked this hotel at a very discounted price @ ₹3.6k.(including breakfast) Thats why i am giving 4 star. It does not worth more than 4k. (As of now)
I hope in future they improve maintenance and also breakfast.

text.text:
stayed at St. Lauren recently, and unfortunately, my experience was far from pleasant. Let me break it down point by point so future guests know what to expect:

1. Cockroaches in the room – Imagine checking in and finding these unwelcome “roommates.” Not the kind of hospitality I was expecting.

2. Swimming pool hygiene – The pool was dirty, and even after complaining, it took the hotel staff an entire day to clean it. Definitely not guest-friendly.

3. Used shaving kit – Shockingly, the kit provided had hair stuck to it. Reusing toiletries for guests is unacceptable and unhygienic.

4. Deceptive photos – Don’t go by the glossy pictures online. The property is old, worn-out, and needs serious maintenance.

5. Food quality – The food was okay, but not excellent. For the price and branding, I expected much better.

6. Non-smoking confusion – I booked a non-smoking room, but later realized the entire hotel is non-smoking. To top it off, they have warnings everywhere about a ₹5,000 penalty if you smoke. Felt more like a restriction than hospitality.

7. Room service – To be fair, this was the only saving grace. The staff attending the room were polite and prompt.

Overall, my stay was a letdown, and I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anyone looking for comfort and value for money.

The Hotel is okay. I stayed from 2/7 to 4/7 in Room 402. As soon as I entered the Hotel the giant blowers above the reception tried to push me out of the Hotel. I did not understand the purpose of these blowers but the blow was certainly not pleasant.
Both days I had to call for bath & hand towel which was surprising. The bath towel was torn. The carpet in the corridor was not clean.
Restaurant serves good Food.
In Buffet Breakfast I found that the arrangement of Juice Jars was incorrect. The jars are placed (in water) behind sandwiches, dhokla and cut fruits. When any of the jar is picked up the water at the outer bottom of the jar drips on the food ( sandwiches, dhokla and cut fruits).  I brought it to the notice of the duty manager. I hope the arrangement has been changed.
All in all not a very pleasant stay.

editorialSummary.text: Polished property in a shopping & entertainment complex, offering a gym, a spa & a rooftop pool.

text.text:
Disappointing Stay – Not Worth the 5-Star Tag

I stayed at E-Square The Fern, Pune with my wife and daughter from August 15 to 17, 2025, and unfortunately, the experience was far from what one would expect from a hotel claiming to be 5-star.

Here are the key issues we faced:

Limited Food Options: The breakfast and dinner buffet had very limited variety, especially for vegetarians. The dinner buffet felt overpriced considering the lack of options and quality.
Remote Location: The hotel is located on the outskirts and is not well-known even among locals, making commuting and navigation inconvenient.
Swimming Pool Not Functional: One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was the swimming pool, which was non-operational during our stay. This was extremely disappointing, especially since I had promised my daughter a fun pool experience. I had to alter our plans last minute and spend extra money to take my family to a water park instead.
Poor Housekeeping Service: Despite turning on the “Make My Room” sign before leaving, the room was not cleaned. I had to call housekeeping after returning. Additionally, the staff left an empty glass outside our room, saying it was from the restaurant and someone else would pick it up. It remained there until we checked out the next morning.
Overall Verdict: With the kind of service and amenities provided, this hotel does not deserve a 5-star rating. At best, it should be rated 3 or 3.5 stars. I would not recommend it for families expecting a premium experience.

text.text:
Had a pleasant stay at The E-Square The Fern Hotel in Pune, and it's definitely a place I’d recommend for both business and leisure travelers.

🔹 Location:
Centrally located and well-connected to key parts of the city. The hotel is part of the E-Square complex, which includes a cinema, eateries, and shopping outlets — a big plus for convenience and entertainment.

🔹 Rooms:
Spacious, clean, and thoughtfully designed. The beds were comfortable, and the in-room amenities were modern and functional. Wi-Fi speed was decent, and housekeeping was prompt.

🔹 Dining:
The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of Indian and continental options. Everything was fresh and well-prepared. Their in-house dining menu is also worth trying, especially if you're looking to unwind without stepping out.

🔹 Service:
The staff was courteous and helpful throughout the stay. Check-in and check-out were smooth, though there could be a bit more attentiveness at peak times.

🔹 Ambience:
The overall vibe is modern yet relaxed. The hotel strikes a good balance between a business-friendly environment and a comfortable leisure stay.

text.text:
A Unique Spiritual Retreat – OSHO International Meditation Resort, Pune

The OSHO International Meditation Resort in Koregaon Park, Pune, offers a one-of-a-kind spiritual and wellness experience unlike any traditional ashram. Spread across a lush, beautifully designed 40-acre campus, the resort blends meditation, modern living, and nature seamlessly. The architecture is minimalist yet luxurious, with meditation halls, water bodies, Zen gardens, and serene pathways that create a deeply calming atmosphere.

The resort offers a structured daily schedule with over 10 types of meditations including Osho Dynamic Meditation, Kundalini, Nadabrahma, and the famous Evening Meeting. These active and passive methods are designed to help release stress and connect deeply with inner silence.

Facilities like the Basho Spa, Olympic-sized swimming pool, gym, and vegetarian dining areas add to the overall wellness-focused lifestyle. The campus is clean, well-managed, and attracts visitors from around the world, creating a global, open-minded community.

However, the resort does have strict entry protocols including HIV testing and required attire (maroon/white robes), and the costs can be relatively high. Still, if you're open to Osho's philosophy and want a meditative yet luxurious environment, this place is worth the experience.

We recently stayed at **Hotel Aurora Towers** during our visit to Pune, and it was a truly pleasant experience. Located conveniently on **MG Road near West End Theatre**, the hotel offers both comfort and accessibility, making it ideal for families and travelers alike.

The hotel is **immaculately clean, tidy, and well-maintained**. From the lobby to the rooms, everything was spotless. The **housekeeping staff deserves special mention** for their consistent efforts in maintaining hygiene and cleanliness throughout our stay.

Our room was spacious and comfortable, with all the necessary amenities. The **room service was prompt**, and the food served was not only **tasty but also kid-friendly**, which made dining in very convenient for our family. The staff was **courteous, attentive, and always ready to help**, adding to the overall positive experience.

Aurora Towers also features a **well-equipped gym and a clean swimming pool**, perfect for relaxing or keeping up with your fitness routine while traveling.

Overall, we had a wonderful stay and would **highly recommend Hotel Aurora Towers** to anyone visiting Pune. Whether you're traveling with family or on a business trip, this hotel offers great value, excellent service, and a prime location in the heart of the city.

text.text:
A Peaceful Retreat at The Fernery Cafe, Hotel Aurora Towers, Pune

Stepping into The Fernery Cafe at Hotel Aurora Towers feels like discovering a hidden gem in the heart of Pune. This all-night cafe truly lives up to its reputation as a calm, quiet, and peaceful haven, making it an ideal spot for a relaxed meal or late-night coffee.

One of the oldest establishments of its kind, The Fernery boasts a wonderful ambiance that exudes comfort and tranquility. The spacious layout, tasteful decor with warm lighting, and well-arranged seating create an inviting atmosphere perfect for quiet conversations or simply unwinding.

Beyond the serene setting, the food is consistently good, offering a satisfying culinary experience. Coupled with its great central location, The Fernery Cafe is a highly recommended destination for anyone seeking a peaceful escape with quality food and a truly pleasant environment in Pune.
They do buffet breakfast at Rs450 for all walkin and guests with a large range of offering !

text.text:
I recently stayed at Parc Estique Hotel, Viman Nagar, from June 29 to July 1, 2025, in Room No. 525, and I would like to share my feedback.

Firstly, the positives:

The reception staff was extremely humble and supportive, making the check-in and overall experience very pleasant.

The restaurant service was commendable, with delicious food and courteous staff.

The room ambiance was excellent – it was well-scented, had a great view, and was kept tidy.

Room service was prompt, and the staff were polite and professional.

It was also appreciated that the room was stocked with a sufficient number of water bottles.

Areas for improvement:

There was no handwash provided in the bathroom, which is a basic hygiene requirement.

Shampoo and body wash supplies were insufficient for the duration of the stay.

A safety concern: where the wooden and tile flooring meet, a nail was protruding from the floor. Unfortunately, I injured myself twice due to this and had to take a tetanus injection as a precaution.

I hope these points are taken in the right spirit to improve the overall guest experience. Despite the mentioned issues, I appreciate the hospitality and look forward to better arrangements on my next visit.

text.text:
Red flag - Disappointing Stay – Unhelpful Staff and overall not recommended.

Terrible Experience – Avoid This Place

We booked 5 rooms, and due to an emergency, one room had to check out a day early. Despite informing the staff, we were still charged for the full stay. When we tried to resolve the issue, the staff were rude, unhelpful, and kept blaming Booking.com instead of taking any responsibility. Their attitude was completely unprofessional and dismissive. The manager had no courtesy to respond to the request rather they vanished post our discussion because their duty hours ended.

The property itself is not very well maintained. Rooms have no ceiling fans—only ACs, making it either freezing or stuffy.. For a hotel, this is ridiculous.

To top it off, they charged our credit cards without any prior notice or approval. That’s a huge red flag and completely unacceptable.

Breakfast was okay, but even that couldn’t make up for the overall experience. The watchman becomes the receptionist in the morning, which says a lot about how this place is run.

I would absolutely not recommend this hotel. Shady billing practices, and zero accountability. Stay away.

text.text:
Marriage Function – 26th April 2024

Extremely disappointing experience. We had high hopes, but the hotel failed on every front.

There was a power failure during the ceremony, and shockingly, even the generator didn’t work. The ACs were not functioning, causing severe discomfort. To add to the mess, the lift wasn’t working either, and there was no backup, forcing elderly guests to use the stairs.

Morning breakfast and tea counters weren’t set up on time, and starters were served cold and poorly managed.

We tried contacting the management, but no one was willing to help or even share a number. The entire day was stressful instead of joyous.

For a venue that claims to host weddings, the lack of planning, professionalism, and basic infrastructure was shocking. Avoid unless they make serious improvements.

R. R. Deshmukh
Retd Sessions Judge

text.text: I stayed at the Fortune Inn Exotica, Hinjewadi twice during my official travel to Pune in June - August, 2017. The hotel is conveniently located on the Hinjewadi main road, very close to the NH 48, and also close to Phase 1 offices and well connected with Phase 2 and 3 as well; thus making it suitable for both business travelers and tourists traveling to and from Mumbai. It is also very near to D-Mart and XION mall which is a plus. Multiple restaurant options are available nearby. Rooms are big, spacious and cleaned regularly. Bathrooms are modern, clean, and sufficiently stacked with kits. But the room decor can do with more attention and the current style can be best described as a bit of drab! Overall look and feel also have opportunity for improvement. However, this shortfall is minor and is made up by the warmth of the hotel stuff and service quality. The management is also attentive. The breakfast buffet is good with multiple choices and typically being included in tariff helps. But ala carte is quite expensive and the overall food quality can be best described as okayish for the price they charge. This is another area where improvement is possible.

text.text:
A “5-Star” Experience… If You’re into Dirty Towels, Rude Staff, and Mosquitoes for Company

Stayed at Oakwood Residence for 2 nights — and I must say, what an eye-opening experience. I usually stay in proper 5-star hotels, but thought I’d give this place a try since it proudly self-proclaims to be a “5-star” property. Big mistake. Should’ve just listened to my instincts (and probably a few older reviews I skipped over).

Let’s start with the few positives:
•	The location is quite decent, peaceful and well-connected.
•	The greenery within the property is honestly refreshing. You do get the feel of being surrounded by nature — a nice touch in a concrete-heavy city.

And that’s where the good stuff ends.

Now, the reality check:
•	Towels with a Personal Touch: The “fresh” towels came complete with bonus strands of hair — perhaps a little too personal for my liking. I guess hygiene isn’t part of their definition of luxury. The washroom had mosquitoes and flies buzzing around like they paid for the room. And the rooms? A mysterious, musty smell that could rival an old storage closet. Pretty sure the bedsheets hadn’t been changed — but hey, maybe that’s part of the eco-friendly experience?
•	Gym or Haunted House?: Decided to check out their so-called fitness center — and what a treat! Dead cockroaches in the corners, glorious spider webs decorating the ceilings, and gym equipment that looked like it was on life support. Most machines creaked dangerously and felt like they might collapse if you dared to use them. Definitely not for the faint-hearted. Honestly, I’ve seen abandoned buildings with better gym setups.
•	Front Desk Hospitality at Its Peak: Mr. Ejaz at the front desk clearly thought he was running a royal palace. His tone, attitude, and dismissive responses were so elite, it almost felt like I was being told off for daring to ask for a copy of my bill. When I requested supporting documentation before signing anything, he looked at me as if I’d insulted the king.
•	Checkout Drama: The lobby was empty, but the staff acted like I was holding up the next 300 guests waiting to check in. They were politely shoving me out of the room, as if I was overstaying my welcome by breathing their air. Such a warm farewell, really brings a tear to your eye.
•	So-Called 5-Star Luxury: If cracked furniture, poor lighting, reused toiletries, weak WiFi, and a humming AC that sounds like a struggling generator are your idea of luxury — then yes, this is a 5-star experience. For the rest of us living in the real world, this place wouldn’t even pass for a 3-star property.

Bottom line: Oakwood Residency is the kind of place that talks big but delivers disappointment. Save your money and your sanity. There are plenty of hotels that actually value guests instead of treating them like an inconvenience.

originalText.text:
A “5-Star” Experience… If You’re into Dirty Towels, Rude Staff, and Mosquitoes for Company

Stayed at Oakwood Residence for 2 nights — and I must say, what an eye-opening experience. I usually stay in proper 5-star hotels, but thought I’d give this place a try since it proudly self-proclaims to be a “5-star” property. Big mistake. Should’ve just listened to my instincts (and probably a few older reviews I skipped over).

Let’s start with the few positives:
•	The location is quite decent, peaceful and well-connected.
•	The greenery within the property is honestly refreshing. You do get the feel of being surrounded by nature — a nice touch in a concrete-heavy city.

And that’s where the good stuff ends.

Now, the reality check:
•	Towels with a Personal Touch: The “fresh” towels came complete with bonus strands of hair — perhaps a little too personal for my liking. I guess hygiene isn’t part of their definition of luxury. The washroom had mosquitoes and flies buzzing around like they paid for the room. And the rooms? A mysterious, musty smell that could rival an old storage closet. Pretty sure the bedsheets hadn’t been changed — but hey, maybe that’s part of the eco-friendly experience?
•	Gym or Haunted House?: Decided to check out their so-called fitness center — and what a treat! Dead cockroaches in the corners, glorious spider webs decorating the ceilings, and gym equipment that looked like it was on life support. Most machines creaked dangerously and felt like they might collapse if you dared to use them. Definitely not for the faint-hearted. Honestly, I’ve seen abandoned buildings with better gym setups.
•	Front Desk Hospitality at Its Peak: Mr. Ejaz at the front desk clearly thought he was running a royal palace. His tone, attitude, and dismissive responses were so elite, it almost felt like I was being told off for daring to ask for a copy of my bill. When I requested supporting documentation before signing anything, he looked at me as if I’d insulted the king.
•	Checkout Drama: The lobby was empty, but the staff acted like I was holding up the next 300 guests waiting to check in. They were politely shoving me out of the room, as if I was overstaying my welcome by breathing their air. Such a warm farewell, really brings a tear to your eye.
•	So-Called 5-Star Luxury: If cracked furniture, poor lighting, reused toiletries, weak WiFi, and a humming AC that sounds like a struggling generator are your idea of luxury — then yes, this is a 5-star experience. For the rest of us living in the real world, this place wouldn’t even pass for a 3-star property.

Bottom line: Oakwood Residency is the kind of place that talks big but delivers disappointment. Save your money and your sanity. There are plenty of hotels that actually value guests instead of treating them like an inconvenience.

text.text:
Oakwood Residency: A Masterclass in Hospitality

Staying at Oakwood Residency was nothing short of extraordinary. Every aspect of my experience left me in awe, redefining what exceptional service truly means.

Culinary Excellence Beyond Compare:
The paneer served here is simply life-changing—the best I’ve ever had. The chefs have set a new gold standard, earning a permanent place at the top of my taste chart. I never thought food could be this memorable.

Thoughtful and Compassionate Staff:
The staff here truly understand the needs of their guests. Many visitors, like me, are individuals who may feel lonely at times, and their warm, genuine greetings made all the difference. It’s a gesture I’ve never seen complimented elsewhere but one I’ll forever cherish.

Immaculate Room Service:
Their attention to detail is astonishing. To test their professionalism, I rearranged cutlery and even changed the bedsheet orientation. By the next day, everything was back to perfection. My in-room slippers were even replaced without a word—a testament to their dedication and silent efficiency.

Lightning-Fast Services:
Every service request I made was fulfilled in a mere 8-9 seconds, thanks to their strategically assigned, floor-specific workforce. It was like clockwork—seamless and impressive.

Punctual and Patient Driver:
On the very first day, I lost my luggage at the airport. The driver didn’t just wait patiently but went out of his way to assist me in every possible way. Even during my daily office commute, he would always be on time and never once complained when I was late. His kindness and professionalism deserve special recognition.

Oakwood Residency doesn’t just provide a place to stay; it offers a holistic experience of care, precision, and excellence. My heartfelt thanks to the entire team for making my stay unforgettable in every way.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar, and I must say it was a truly delightful experience. From the moment I walked through the doors, the hotel's warm and inviting atmosphere captivated me. The exceptional service and attention to detail exceeded my expectations in every way possible.

The staff at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar truly went above and beyond to ensure my comfort and satisfaction throughout my stay. Their friendly and welcoming demeanor made me feel right at home. They were always ready to assist with any queries or requests, displaying an unmatched level of professionalism.

The room I stayed in was spacious, clean, and beautifully designed. It had all the amenities one could ask for, including a comfortable bed, a well-stocked minibar, and a modern bathroom. The attention to detail was evident in the meticulous cleanliness and thoughtfully arranged furnishings.

What impressed me the most was the hotel's commitment to providing an exceptional guest experience. They offered me a free late check-out option, allowing me to relax and enjoy my stay without feeling rushed. Furthermore, the complimentary drop-off service to the airport was an unexpected and generous gesture that made my departure hassle-free.

The dining options at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar were fantastic. The breakfast buffet showcased a wide variety of delicious dishes, catering to different tastes and dietary preferences. The restaurant staff was attentive, ensuring that every guest was taken care of with a smile.

The hotel's location in Vimannagar was ideal for both business and leisure travelers. It provided easy access to the airport and was in close proximity to several popular attractions and shopping centers. Additionally, the surrounding neighborhood felt safe and vibrant, with numerous dining and entertainment options within walking distance.

Overall, my stay at Lemon Tree Hotel Vimannagar was nothing short of exceptional. The staff's dedication to providing impeccable service, the comfortable and well-appointed rooms, and the thoughtful amenities created a memorable experience for me. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area and look forward to returning on my future trips.

text.text:
Title: A Delightful Stay at Central Park Hotel

Review:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Central Park Hotel during my visit to the city, and I must say it exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I stepped into the elegant lobby, I was greeted by friendly and attentive staff who made me feel genuinely welcome.

The hotel's location is truly unbeatable, nestled right in the heart of the city with easy access to numerous attractions and transportation options. It was a delight to have Central Park just a stone's throw away, allowing me to take leisurely walks and soak in the serene ambiance of the park whenever I desired.

The room I stayed in was impeccably clean, spacious, and tastefully decorated. The comfortable bed provided me with a restful sleep after a long day of exploring the city. I particularly appreciated the attention to detail in the room's amenities, such as the high-quality toiletries and plush bathrobes that added a touch of luxury to my stay.

The hotel's dining options were equally impressive. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of delicious choices to suit all tastes, and the attentive staff ensured I had everything I needed. The hotel's restaurant also provided a delectable culinary experience, with a diverse menu showcasing both local and international cuisine.

One aspect that truly stood out during my stay was the exceptional service provided by the hotel staff. They were knowledgeable, courteous, and went above and beyond to make sure all my needs were met. Whether it was providing recommendations for local attractions or arranging transportation, their professionalism and genuine care were evident throughout.

Additionally, Central Park Hotel boasts excellent facilities, including a well-equipped fitness center and a relaxing spa where I indulged in a rejuvenating massage. The hotel's attention to guest comfort and convenience truly enhanced my overall experience.

In conclusion, Central Park Hotel offers a perfect blend of elegance, convenience, and exceptional service. It exceeded my expectations in every aspect and made my stay truly memorable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city, and I look forward to returning on my next trip.

Overview:
St. Laurn Hotel Pune is part of the St. Laurn group of hotels, known for their upscale accommodations and hospitality services. The hotel is strategically located in Pune, catering to both business and leisure travelers.

Accommodations:
The hotel features a range of comfortable rooms and suites designed with modern decor and amenities. Guests can expect a relaxing and pleasant stay with a variety of room options to choose from.

Dining Options:
St. Laurn Hotel Pune offers dining options that cater to different tastes. The hotel's restaurants and bars include Café 15A (all-day dining), Eclair (pastry shop), and Balaji Garden (open-air dining). Guests can savor a variety of culinary delights during their stay.

Meetings and Events:
The hotel provides facilities for meetings, conferences, weddings, and social events. It offers well-equipped banquet halls, meeting rooms, and outdoor venues, making it suitable for hosting a range of events.

Recreational Facilities:
Guests can relax and unwind at the hotel's fitness center and swimming pool. The hotel may also offer spa and wellness services for those looking to rejuvenate.

Location:
St. Laurn Hotel Pune is conveniently located in Pune, providing easy access to business districts, shopping areas, and tourist attractions in the city.

Service Excellence:
The hotel is committed to providing exceptional service, with a professional staff dedicated to ensuring a comfortable and enjoyable stay for guests.

Business Facilities:
For business travelers, the hotel may offer business center services, high-speed internet access, and other amenities to facilitate work-related needs.

Special Packages:
St. Laurn Hotel Pune may offer special packages, promotions, and discounts for guests, so it's advisable to check their website or contact the hotel directly for the latest offers.

In summary, St. Laurn Hotel Pune is a well-regarded hotel in Pune known for its comfortable accommodations, dining options, and event facilities. Whether you're visiting Pune for business or leisure, the hotel aims to provide a pleasant and memorable stay for its guests.

text.text:
A Unique Spiritual Retreat – OSHO International Meditation Resort, Pune

The OSHO International Meditation Resort in Koregaon Park, Pune, offers a one-of-a-kind spiritual and wellness experience unlike any traditional ashram. Spread across a lush, beautifully designed 40-acre campus, the resort blends meditation, modern living, and nature seamlessly. The architecture is minimalist yet luxurious, with meditation halls, water bodies, Zen gardens, and serene pathways that create a deeply calming atmosphere.

The resort offers a structured daily schedule with over 10 types of meditations including Osho Dynamic Meditation, Kundalini, Nadabrahma, and the famous Evening Meeting. These active and passive methods are designed to help release stress and connect deeply with inner silence.

Facilities like the Basho Spa, Olympic-sized swimming pool, gym, and vegetarian dining areas add to the overall wellness-focused lifestyle. The campus is clean, well-managed, and attracts visitors from around the world, creating a global, open-minded community.

However, the resort does have strict entry protocols including HIV testing and required attire (maroon/white robes), and the costs can be relatively high. Still, if you're open to Osho's philosophy and want a meditative yet luxurious environment, this place is worth the experience.

I warmly recommend a visit, whether alone, as a couple or in a group.

text.text:
The Oakwood Hotel, Deccan, Pune: An Overview

The Oakwood Hotel, located in the bustling Deccan area of Pune, is a well-known 3-star property that offers comfortable accommodation and easy access to some of the city's most vibrant spots. With its modern amenities and convenient location, it caters primarily to business travelers, families, and tourists looking for a cozy stay close to the city’s cultural and commercial hubs.

Key Highlights

1. Prime Location: The hotel’s central location in Deccan Gymkhana makes it ideal for those looking to explore Pune’s popular attractions like Shaniwar Wada, Fergusson College Road, and JM Road. It's also close to shopping areas, restaurants, and entertainment venues, making it a great choice for both leisure and business travelers.

2. Comfortable Accommodation: The Oakwood offers a range of well-maintained rooms, including Executive and Deluxe rooms, designed to provide a relaxing stay. The rooms are equipped with modern amenities like air conditioning, flat-screen TVs, complimentary Wi-Fi, a minibar, and coffee/tea makers. The interiors are simple yet elegant, ensuring comfort after a busy day in the city.

3. On-Site Dining: The in-house restaurant serves a variety of Indian, Chinese, and Continental cuisines, with both buffet and à la carte options. The breakfast spread is especially appreciated by guests, offering a mix of local and international dishes. Room service is also available for those who prefer to dine in the comfort of their rooms.

4. Business Facilities: The hotel features conference rooms and meeting facilities, making it suitable for business events and gatherings. The staff is accommodating and can assist in organizing small to medium-sized events.

5. Additional Amenities: The Oakwood offers a range of facilities, including a fitness center, 24-hour front desk, laundry services, and airport transfers on request. The friendly and attentive staff ensure that guests have a pleasant and hassle-free stay.

Visitor Experience

Clean and Cozy Ambiance: Guests appreciate the clean and comfortable rooms, with the hotel maintaining high standards of hygiene. The decor is tasteful, focusing on functionality and comfort.

Efficient Service: The staff is often praised for their courteous and prompt service, ensuring guests feel welcome. The check-in and check-out processes are smooth, making it a convenient option for business travelers on a tight schedule.

Quiet and Peaceful Stay: Despite being in a busy area, the hotel manages to offer a quiet and peaceful environment, allowing guests to unwind after a hectic day in the city.

Tips for Visitors

Parking Availability: The hotel offers parking, but spaces may be limited during peak times. It’s advisable to inform the hotel in advance if you’re arriving by car.

Book Early for Discounts: If you’re planning to visit during peak seasons or weekends, it’s best to book early to secure better rates.

Nearby Dining Options: While the hotel’s restaurant is good, there are plenty of other dining options nearby on Fergusson College Road and JM Road if you wish to explore different cuisines.

Pros

Central location with easy access to popular tourist spots and commercial areas.

Comfortable rooms with modern amenities for a relaxed stay.

Friendly and attentive staff who are eager to assist with any needs.

Cons

Limited parking space, especially during busy hours.

The fitness center may be smaller compared to other hotels.

Some guests have noted that the room decor feels slightly dated and could use a refresh.

Final Thoughts

The Oakwood Hotel, Deccan, Pune is an excellent option for travelers who want a convenient and comfortable stay in the heart of the city without breaking the bank. Whether you're in Pune for business or leisure, this hotel offers a pleasant experience with its strategic location, attentive service, and well-appointed rooms.

It’s especially recommended for those who value proximity to Pune's key attractions and enjoy exploring the city’s bustling areas like Fergusson College Road, which is just

text.text:
The Oakwood is a surprise located what might be the center of Pune? Not so sure but wonderful location, not far from Fergusson College, BORI etc. A short distance from other institutes - Gokhale, Symbiosis and even SPPU.
The hotel is compact but very organized. The rooms are spacious, with concealed AC and a comfortable bed, enough closet space, a worktable, USB charge points, kettle, fridge - all provided.
The shower area is closed off by a glass door and the shower works well - hot and cold - no issues.
**One felt the absence of an exhaust fan in the bathroom, though.**
But overall nice, sober aesthetics to the room decor.
The lift is smooth and quick.
Now about the included breakfast - that is a highlight! For vegetarians esp. A variety of fresh fruit, iddlis, chutney, paratha, poha, yogurt etc etc. It is sumptuous and filling - and tasty. Kudos to the management and kitchen team for this amazing effort.
Overall very pleasant experience in the heart of Pune. Great front-desk people also.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Pride Hotel in Pune for one night and enjoyed a delightful morning breakfast during my stay. I must say that my experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I arrived until the time I left, I was impressed with the hotel's hospitality, facilities, and the overall quality of service.

Upon check-in, I was warmly greeted by the friendly and professional staff at the reception. The check-in process was smooth and efficient, and I was quickly escorted to my room. The room itself was spacious, tastefully decorated, and impeccably clean. The comfortable bed ensured a restful night's sleep, and the amenities provided added to the overall convenience and comfort of my stay.

One of the highlights of my stay was the morning breakfast at the hotel. The Pride Hotel Pune offers a wide variety of options to cater to different tastes and preferences. The breakfast buffet consisted of an extensive spread of both Indian and international dishes. From fresh fruits and pastries to hot and savory items, there was something for everyone. The quality of the food was excellent, and the attentive staff made sure that everything was replenished promptly.

The Pride Hotel's location is also worth noting. Situated in a convenient area of Pune, it offers easy access to various popular landmarks, shopping centers, and business districts. This made it convenient for me to explore the city during my short stay.

Overall, my experience at The Pride Hotel Pune for a one-night stay and morning breakfast was outstanding. The hotel's commitment to providing top-notch service, combined with its well-appointed rooms and delicious breakfast offerings, made it a memorable stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Pune, whether it be for business or leisure, and I look forward to returning in the future.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Royal Orchid Golden Suite and I must say, it far exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I stepped foot into the hotel, I was greeted with warm smiles and exceptional service. Allow me to share some highlights from my stay.

First and foremost, the hotel's location is superb. Situated in a prime location, it offers convenient access to the city's attractions, shopping centers, and restaurants. Whether you're a business traveler or a tourist, the hotel's central location is an ideal base for exploring the vibrant city.

The spaciousness and elegance of the Royal Orchid Golden Suite truly impressed me. The room I stayed in was beautifully decorated and well-appointed with modern amenities. The attention to detail in design and comfort was evident. The bed was luxuriously comfortable, providing me with a restful night's sleep after a long day of exploring. The suite also featured a separate living area, which was perfect for relaxing or catching up on work.

The impeccable service provided by the hotel staff deserves special mention. They went above and beyond to ensure my stay was as pleasant as possible. From the swift check-in process to the thoughtful recommendations for local dining options, the staff's professionalism and attentiveness were truly commendable. Any requests or inquiries I had were promptly addressed, creating a seamless and stress-free experience.

The hotel facilities were top-notch. The fitness center was well-equipped, allowing me to maintain my workout routine during my stay. Additionally, the rooftop pool offered a serene oasis amidst the bustling city. I enjoyed lounging by the poolside, soaking in the stunning views and sipping on refreshing cocktails from the poolside bar.

Lastly, the dining experience at the Royal Orchid Golden Suite was extraordinary. The breakfast buffet featured an extensive selection of both local and international cuisine, catering to all tastes. The quality and freshness of the food were exceptional, and the attentive service from the dining staff truly made each meal a memorable experience.

In conclusion, my stay at the Royal Orchid Golden Suite was nothing short of exceptional. The staff's impeccable service, luxurious accommodations, convenient location, and remarkable dining options truly elevated my experience. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. I'm already eagerly looking forward to my next visit to the Royal Orchid Golden Suite.

text.text:
Hotel Ambience Excellency offers a comfortable and enjoyable stay for its guests. The hotel is well-located, making it convenient for both business and leisure travelers. The rooms are clean, well-maintained, and equipped with modern amenities, ensuring a pleasant stay.

The staff at the hotel are friendly and attentive, always ready to assist with any needs. The in-house restaurant, Namah, serves a variety of delicious dishes, and the morning breakfast spread is particularly impressive, offering a good mix of local and international options.

One of the highlights of the hotel is its rooftop bar, which provides a relaxing atmosphere and a great view of the city. The fitness center is well-equipped, although it could benefit from a few more machines. The hotel also offers free high-speed internet, which is a big plus for business travelers.

While the hotel excels in many areas, there are a few aspects that could be improved. The parking area can get crowded during peak hours, and some guests have mentioned that the rooms could be a bit more spacious. However, these minor issues do not detract from the overall positive experience.

In summary, Hotel Ambience Excellency in Wakad is a solid choice for anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient stay in Pune. The friendly staff, clean rooms, and good food make it a place worth considering for your next visit.

text.text:
Swan Hotel Stay Review

I recently stayed at Swan Hotel on JM Road. Sharing my experience.

Location: Conveniently situated in the city on JM Road, Swan Hotel offers easy access to nearby attractions.

Parking: The hotel has limited parking inside the premises, which can be a consideration for guests with vehicles.

Room: Although the rooms are small, they are well-maintained and clean, ensuring a comfortable stay.

Noise Level: Due to its proximity to JM Road, there maybe some traffic noise, so light sleepers may want to take note.

Dining Options: While the hotel doesn't have a restaurant, they serve only breakfast on the rooftop. Additionally, they can arrange food from a nearby hotel for guests, with a focus on vegetarian options(only) .

Nearby Restaurants: There are decent vegetarian and non-vegetarian restaurants in the vicinity. For non-vegetarian lovers, I recommend trying Manas Satara hotel, which is within walking distance from Swan Hotel.

Overall, Swan Hotel is a suitable choice for those looking for a clean and well-located stay, with options for dining both within the hotel and in the surrounding area."
